comments.author: mwu.code@gmail.com
comments.text:
From https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=696042#c25

"We're going to want to filter these change notifications.  There's
code in the android backend to do this, but it should be centralized.
Let's file a followup to centralize it."
comments.raw_text:
From https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=696042#c25

"We're going to want to filter these change notifications.  There's
code in the android backend to do this, but it should be centralized.
Let's file a followup to centralize it."
comments.creator: mwu.code@gmail.com
mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.raw_text: FWIW, when there is a notification sent from hal to the DOM, there is no DOM event sent if there is no real change. Filtering will only prevent doing the hal to DOM path. I did filter that on Android because it goes trough JNI and IPC. I don't know how critical this path is for B2G.
comments.author: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.text: FWIW, when there is a notification sent from hal to the DOM, there is no DOM event sent if there is no real change. Filtering will only prevent doing the hal to DOM path. I did filter that on Android because it goes trough JNI and IPC. I don't know how critical this path is for B2G.

Let's try to share this code centrally in hal if possible, so the logic is the same.  Same with estimating remaining battery, if the system doesn't do it for us.  The dispatch path on android is more expensive than the gonk path so we may be forced to filter earlier on android.  But let's measure.
comments.author: cjones.bugs@gmail.com
comments.creator: cjones.bugs@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Let's try to share this code centrally in hal if possible, so the logic is the same.  Same with estimating remaining battery, if the system doesn't do it for us.  The dispatch path on android is more expensive than the gonk path so we may be forced to filter earlier on android.  But let's measure.

comments.creator: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.text: Should be easy to do: we should just compare the data we get in NotifyFooInformation with the currently cached data (in Hal.cpp).
comments.author: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.raw_text: Should be easy to do: we should just compare the data we get in NotifyFooInformation with the currently cached data (in Hal.cpp).

comments.author: cjones.bugs@gmail.com
comments.text: Yep.  Same for remaining time estimation; if the incoming data has a sentinel value for remainingTime, then we compute it in Hal.cpp.
comments.creator: cjones.bugs@gmail.com
